entry.title: [GTN news] New Feature: a feedback page to aggregate and display feedback answers

link.title: [GTN news] New Feature: a feedback page to aggregate and display feedback answers

entry.content:
As you have probably already seen, a feedback form is embedded on the bottom of each tutorial.

The answers are automatically posted to a GitHub issue. With > 1,300 answers, it is quite difficult to keep an eye on the answers, specially because the answers there are for all tutorials, but also to have an overview of the answers.

How can we have the feedback for a specific tutorial? Or for all the tutorials for a topic? How many feedback has been submitted? Are the tutorials appreciated?

To answer some of these questions and help contributors, we created a page which aggregate all feedback, display them globally, but also by topic and tutorials, including the free text.

The data from the feedback are automatically extracted every week to update the page and its graphs. The page is linked in the “Extras” menu on the top (with direct link to interesting section from topic and tutorial pages).

Visit the Feedback page
entry.summary: As you have probably already seen, a feedback form is embedded on the bottom of each tutorial.

entry.title: [GTN news] Accessibility Improvements
entry.content:
Accessibility Improvements

One of our community members suggested on twitter that we support alternative formats for accessing our JavaScript based slides, as this can be difficult for users using screen readers. We’ve now added support for “plain text slides”, where we render the slide decks as a single long document.

The rendering is imperfect, due to how our slide deck library handles custom classes within slides, but it should still be an improvement for anyone who wants to scroll through the slides in an alternative format. You can find them linked from the first slide of each slide deck, or from the slides dropdown in the topic pages, check them out!

Additionally we’ve made a number of other minor accessibility improvements:

  • Fixed 533 missing alt texts for images
  • Removed some repetitive icon names names when followed immediately by their descriptive text
  • Remove repetitive image labels on author badges.
  • etc.

Some of these were done after (Helena Rasche) learned to use Android’s TalkBack and noticed the site could be unpleasant to go through. While absolutely not a replacement for someone who deeply understands the needs of visually impaired users or experiences such needs themselves, hopefully this makes the GTN a little bit more pleasant for everyone.

entry.title: Freiburg Galaxy Team at the Galaxy Community Conference 2021

link.title: Freiburg Galaxy Team at the Galaxy Community Conference 2021

entry.content:
The Freiburg Galaxy Team participated in the Galaxy Community Conference 2021 with:

  • Talks
  • Posters/Demos
  • BoF (Birds of Feather)
  • CoFest
  • and training

To learn more about the Galaxy Community Conference 2021, please read our post: “Highlights from the Galaxy Community Conference 2021”

Talks

Galaxy as a global platform for the analysis of SARS-CoV-2 sequence variants

Wolfgang Maier

With Anton Nekrutenko; Sergei Pond; the covid19.galaxyproject.org; covid19.datamonkey.org and Viral Beacon

Abstract

Overhaul and pagination in Data-Libraries

Oleg Zharkov

Abstract, Slides

How UseGalaxy.EU is managed - tips and tricks from inside

Gianmauro Cuccuru

With Helena Rasche

Abstract, Slides

Analysis of Microscopy Data in Galaxy

Beatriz Serrano-Solano

With Yi Sun; Jeremy Goecks; Jean-Karim Hériché

Abstract, Slides

Modernizing the Galaxy Backend - Typing and the API

David López

With Galaxy Backend Working Group

Abstract, Slides

Galaxy Language Server - Develop high-quality Galaxy tool wrappers at intergalactic speed

David López

Abstract

Posters / Demos

GPU enabled Jupyterlab notebook for deep learning using Tensorflow in Galaxy

Anup Kumar

Abstract, Slides

Automating Galaxy tool requirement updates with Planemo

Simon Bray

With Lorraine Coelho; Björn Grüning

Abstract

Galaxy as a global platform for the analysis of SARS-CoV-2 sequence variants

Wolfgang Maier

With Anton Nekrutenko; Sergei Pond; the covid19.galaxyproject.org; covid19.datamonkey.org and Viral Beacon

Abstract

BoF

GTN-Español - Bioinformatics resources in human-translated Spanish

Co-organized by Beatriz Serrano-Solano

We’re trying to move beyond Google-translate into manually translated tutorials, slide-decks, and videos in Spanish for a workshop. Anyone who speaks Spanish and would be keen to get involved in developing or testing these resources would be very welcome! And double gold star if you know anything about translation or automated translation, as long-term we want to see how we can power this up bigger scale.

Galaxy for Microbiome - Kickoff

Co-organized by Bérénice Batut

Many efforts on microbiome analysis are done in Galaxy but we do not communicate so much together about them. To avoid redundancy and coordinate our efforts, we would like to start a “Galaxy for Microbiome” community.

We started to collect ideas about this community in a shared document. We would like now to properly kickoff this community. What is better to kickoff a community than a BoF at GCC?

Galaxy & Training / Teaching

Co-organized by Bérénice Batut; Björn Grüning

Discussions on using Galaxy for training / teaching and the Galaxy Training Network community:

  • training material (recent and future developments)
  • using Galaxy for undergraduate instruction
  • training / teaching delivery and events
  • community building (instructors, contributors, users, mentoring)

CoFest

GCC ends with two days gathering community members who are interested in contributing to Galaxy’s code base, available tool set, documentation, training materials, and anywhere else that expands the Galaxy ecosystem.

The Freiburg Galaxy team participated in several projects

  • Microbial & Microbiome tool integration and update
  • Community Directory
  • Creating learning paths within the Galaxy Training Network
  • Populating FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions) pages in the GTN
  • Workflows (IWC)
  • and many more informal projects

Training

The Freiburg Galaxy team supported the GCC2021 Training Week by providing videos (below), developping and updating material, helping participants by answering their questions on Slack, helping with captions for videos, etc!

Running Workflows from the Command Line using Planemo

Simon Bray

With Wolfgang Maier

Material

  • Tutorial

Assembly: Unicycler assembly of SARS-CoV-2 genome

Cristóbal Gallardo

Material

  • Slides
  • Tutorial

Reference-based RNA-Seq data analysis

Bérénice Batut

Material

  • Tutorial

Whole transcriptome analysis of Arabidopsis thaliana

Cristóbal Gallardo

Material

  • Slides
  • Tutorial

Analysis of plant scRNA-Seq Data with Scanpy

Mehmet Tekman

Material

  • Tutorial

Introduction to Machine Learning

Anup Kumar

Material

  • Slides

Classification in Machine Learning

Anup Kumar

Material

  • Tutorial
  • Slides

Regression in Machine Learning

Anup Kumar

Material

  • Tutorial
  • Slides

High Throughput Molecular Dynamics and Analysis

Simon Bray

Material

  • Tutorial

Creating a new Tutorial

Bérénice Batut

Material

  • Tutorial

entry.title: UseGalaxy.eu Use Case: Epigenomics and transcriptomics in cancer

link.title: UseGalaxy.eu Use Case: Epigenomics and transcriptomics in cancer

entry.content:
Mzwanele Ngubo uses Galaxy for cancer research at The Ottawa Hospital Research Institute, Regenerative Medicine, Ottawa (Canada). Thanks Mzwanele!

My research projects seek to map the epigenomic and transcriptomic alterations in cancer, and delineate the higher order chromatin organization during aging. UseGalaxy.eu resources are useful in our analysis of such computationally intensive biomedical datasets. This infrastructure is quite beneficial even to research scientists without computer programming or systems administration background.
entry.summary: Mzwanele Ngubo uses Galaxy for cancer research at The Ottawa Hospital Research Institute, Regenerative Medicine, Ottawa (Canada). Thanks Mzwanele!
